medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Skin lesions began appearing approximately 2 months after completing chemotherapy for ALCL. The patient had been well until approximately 9 months ago, when small, slightly pruritic papules developed on her left breast, chest, and back. New lesions appeared 2 months after chemotherapy completion, with the most recent lesions having partially improved with topical treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, gastroesophageal reflux disease, arthritis, obesity, history of cutaneous squamous-cell and basal-cell carcinomas, numerous cysts, acneiform lesions, and actinic keratoses.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of breast cancer, sister had thyroid cancer, brother had nonmelanoma skin cancer, and son is healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Divorced, lives alone in southeastern United States, employed, has an 80-pack-year history of smoking (stopped 2 years ago), and consumes two alcoholic beverages daily.
